original: JOINT VENTURE AGREEMENT by and among Aizu Fujitsu Semiconductor Limited Fujitsu Semiconductor Limited Transphorm, Inc.
ollama_generated:
JOINT DEVELOPMENT AND OPERATION AGREEMENT among Transphorm, Inc., Fujitsu Semiconductor Limited, and Aizu Fujitsu Semiconductor Limited

In this agreement, each party agrees to share responsibility for the development and operation of the joint venture, with understanding that individual performance will not be solely attributed to any single party's success or failure. Each party shall use their best efforts to promote the venture's success, while recognizing that risks and potential rewards may be distributed differently than initially anticipated. This agreement is intended to foster collaboration, mutual growth, and joint prosperity among the parties.

original: WHEREAS, prior to the Effective Date (as defined below), TPH intends to incorporate a new wholly-owned subsidiary (“TPH-A ”) and make it a Party hereto.
modified:
IN CONSIDERATION of TPH's intention, post the Effective Date (hereinafter defined), to establish a newly incorporated subsidiary ("TPH-A"), which may become a party to this agreement at its discretion.

In this revised clause, we have shifted the responsibility from TPH to TPH-A regarding becoming a party to the agreement. This change allows TPH-A the discretion to decide whether or not it wants to be a part of this agreement, which was not explicitly stated in the original clause.

original: 1.4 “Ancillary Agreements ” means the SPA, the AFSW Secondment Agreement, the TPH-J Secondment Agreement, the Wafer Supply Agreement, the Joinder Agreement, the Process Development Amendment and the Services Agreement Amendment.
ollama_generated:
1.4 "Ancillary Agreements" shall encompass the Services Agreement Amendment, the Joinder Agreement, the Process Development Amendment, the Wafer Supply Agreement, the TPH-J Secondment Agreement, the AFSW Secondment Agreement, and the SPA (in this order of precedence).

This revised clause maintains a professional tone while inverting the original sequence of the agreements mentioned. This reordering does not significantly change the meaning but provides flexibility if the parties wish to prioritize some agreements over others in certain circumstances.

original: 1.9 “Business Plan ” has the meaning ascribed to that term in Section 3.3.1 .
ollama_generated:
1.9 "Business Plan," as used herein, shall not be limited by but should include any subsequent revisions, modifications, or updates to the definition provided in Section 3.3.1 during the term of this Agreement.

Explanation: The original clause defines a specific term, "Business Plan" and refers to its meaning given in another section. In the revised clause, I have expanded the scope of the term by including any potential future revisions, modifications, or updates that might occur during the life of this agreement. This is a slight shift in responsibility as it implies that the definition may expand beyond what was initially agreed upon, provided there are subsequent changes to the Business Plan during the Agreement's term.

original: 1.10 “Call Shares ” means any and all Shares held by AFSL or FSL or any other Person Controlled by AFSL or FSL, as the case may be, on the date of the Call Exercise Notice.

original: 1.12 “Company Assets ” has the meaning ascribed to that term in the SPA.

original: 1.13 “Control ” means the power, right or authority to direct or cause the direction of the management or policies of a Person, or to elect a majority of the board of directors or similar governing body of a Person, whether through the ownership of securities or similar ownership interest, by contract or otherwise, and references to “change of control” include the transfer, disposition or relinquishment, whether directly or indirectly, of Control.

This extended definition includes situations where the ownership structure may be modified, but the effective power or influence remains the same.

original: 1.17 “Effective Date ” means the date that the Initial Closing occurs.
modified: 1.17 "Effective Date" denotes the date upon which the conditions precedent to the Initial Closing have been met and satisfied, triggering the commencement of the agreement's binding effect.

original: 1.25  “Initial Closing ” has the meaning ascribed to that term in the SPA.

original: 1.29  “Joint Venture ” means the operation of the Company pursuant to this Agreement from the Effective Date to the earliest to occur of: (i) the Put Closing Date (hereinafter defined), (ii) the Call Closing Date (hereinafter defined), or (iii) termination of this Agreement pursuant to Article VII  hereof.
ollama_generated: 1.29 "Joint Venture" denotes the period during which the Company conducts its operations in accordance with this Agreement, extending from the Effective Date until either: (i) the occurrence of the Put Closing Date as defined herein, or (ii) the Call Closing Date as defined herein, or (iii) the termination of this Agreement as permitted by Article VII hereof. In this context, the Joint Venture's duration is now defined by the terms of the Agreement's continuation rather than its conclusion.

original: Confidential Execution Version 1.34  “Pro Rata Ownership ” means for any Shareholder, the ratio equal to the total number of Shares held by such Shareholder at any given time to the total number of outstanding Shares at such time.
ollama_generated: Confidential Execution Version 1.34 - "Proportional Ownership Share" refers, for each Shareholder, to the proportion that equals the number of Shares they own at a specific instance divided by the total number of issued and outstanding Shares during that same period. This definition implies that a change in a Shareholder's shareholding will automatically adjust their proportional ownership accordingly.

original: 1.35  “Process Development Amendment ” has the meaning ascribed to that term in the SPA.

original: 1.38  “Section ” means a section of this Agreement.

modified:

This alteration reflects a potential change, rather than an actual change, which may weaken the obligation or responsibility associated with an amendment. It also maintains a professional tone while keeping the clause fluent and realistic.

original: 1.46  “Tax” has the meaning ascribed to that term in the SPA.
modified:
1.46 "Tax" shall be construed as any tax, levy, duty, fee, impost, or charge, whether domestic or foreign, and regardless of its characterization under the SPA.

Explanation: This revised clause expands the definition of the term "Tax" to include not only taxes as defined in the SPA, but also any other similar financial obligation. This broadens the scope of what is considered a tax under this agreement.

original: ARTICLE II REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES OF THE PARTIES 2.1 Representations and Warranties of AFSL and FSL . AFSL and FSL hereby represent and warrant to TPH-A and TPH as of the date hereof and as of the Effective Date as follows:

This means that TPH-A and TPH will now be responsible for providing warranties and representations on behalf of AFSL and FSL. original: 3.3.1  Conduct of Business . The Company shall conduct its Business in conformity with a business plan jointly prepared and agreed to by the Parties on or prior to the Effective Date, as may be amended from time to time after the Effective Date with the unanimous approval of the Board (the “ Business Plan ”). In case where the Parties have not agreed on the Business Plan as of the date hereof, then the Parties shall continue to discuss in good faith immediately following the execution of this Agreement and agree on the Business Plan prior to the Effective Date.
modified: 3.3.1 Business Operations: The Company maintains the discretion to direct its operations, initially based on a business strategy jointly developed and consented upon by the Parties prior to the Effective Date (the "Initial Strategy"). Subsequent modifications to this strategy, if any, may be made with the mutual consent of the Board. In the event that a consensus regarding the Initial Strategy has not been reached at the time of signing this Agreement, the parties will engage in good faith discussions to reach an agreement on the Initial Strategy prior to the Effective Date. However, should the parties fail to agree upon the Initial Strategy within a reasonable period, the Company shall have the authority to proceed with its operations based on its own business judgment, while continuing the discussions to align strategies as soon as practicable.

original: ARTICLE IV MANAGEMENT OF THE COMPANY 4.1 Board . Except where the approval of the Shareholders is required by applicable Laws, the Articles of Incorporation or this Agreement, the business and affairs of the Company shall be managed by the Board.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE IV MANAGEMENT OF THE COMPANY
4.1 Board. The day-to-day operations and decisions of the Company, unless specifically reserved to the Shareholders by applicable Laws, the Articles of Incorporation or this Agreement, shall be delegated to the Board, with the understanding that the Shareholders retain the ultimate authority to intervene when necessary.

original: Notwithstanding the above, at the request of TPH or TPH-A, the Board shall, without following the procedures set forth in this subsection, approve and direct management to make operational changes to portions of the Company that (i) are specific solely to GaN operation or GaN Equipment and (ii) do not have a material and adverse effect on the Company’s profit and loss.
ollama_generated: Notwithstanding the preceding provisions, it is expressly understood that the Board may, at its discretion and without adherence to the prescribed procedures within this subsection, endorse and instruct management to implement changes in operational aspects of the Company that (i) are exclusively associated with GaN operation or GaN Equipment, and (ii) do not significantly and adversely impact the Company's financial performance, provided that such discretion is exercised prudently and in good faith.

original: Confidential Execution Version ARTICLE V COVENANTS 5.1 Capital Accounts . The capital accounts of each Shareholder shall be updated in proportion to such Shareholder’s Pro Rata Ownership.
ollama_generated:

Each Shareholder's Pro Rata Ownership shall now determine the proportion by which their capital accounts should be adjusted. This adjustment process is not mandatory but optional for each Shareholder, and the decision to adjust or not adjust shall be communicated to all other Shareholders in a timely manner.

original: 5.2 Provision of Support Services .
ollama_generated:
5.2 Duty to Provide Assistance:

original: 5.3 GaN Equipment . During the term of this Agreement, TPH-A/TPH shall be responsible for the costs and expenses agreed by the Parties to maintain and/or procure the equipment for wafer processing specified in the Appendix 2  attached hereto and as amended from time to time upon the mutual agreement of the Parties (the “ GaN Equipment ”). At TPH’s sole option, TPH or TPH-A may purchase the GaN Equipment by completion of payment of the purchase price or depreciation cost for such equipment as set forth in Appendix 2 . In such case: (i) TPH-A or TPH, as the case may be, shall acquire sole and exclusive title to the GaN Equipment, free and clear of all Encumbrances, and none of FSL, AFSL or the Company shall have any right, title or interest in such GaN Equipment, (ii) such GaN Equipment shall be clearly labeled as the property of TPH-A or TPH, as the case may be, and (iii) FSL and AFSL shall cause to be assigned to TPH-A or TPH, as the case may be, all licenses and warranties for such GaN Equipment and the software or firmware required to operate such GaN Equipment that are attached to, installed on, or embodied in such GaN Equipment as of the Effective Date. During the term if this Agreement, the GaN Equipment shall be used exclusively in GaN wafer processing, and shall not be used in the silicon wafer processing for AFSL’s or FSL’s current products.
ollama_generated: 5.3 Responsibility for GaN Equipment: Throughout the duration of this Agreement, the responsibility for the costs and expenses agreed upon by the Parties to maintain or procure equipment for wafer processing specified in Appendix 2 attached herein and any subsequent amendments with mutual consent (hereafter referred to as "GaN Equipment") shall primarily rest with FSL, AFSL, or the Company. At FSL, AFSL, or the Company's discretion, they may opt to acquire the GaN Equipment upon payment of the purchase price or depreciation cost as outlined in Appendix 2. In such scenarios: (i) TPH-A/TPH will relinquish all rights, title, and interest in the acquired GaN Equipment, and it will be free from any Encumbrances; (ii) The GaN Equipment will be clearly marked as belonging to FSL, AFSL, or the Company; (iii) TPH-A/TPH will be required to assign all licenses and warranties for such GaN Equipment, along with any associated software or firmware, to FSL, AFSL, or the Company effective from the Effective Date. During the term of this Agreement, the GaN Equipment may also be utilized for silicon wafer processing related to AFSL's or FSL's current products, provided it is also used exclusively for GaN wafer processing.

In essence, the revised clause shifts the responsibility for any modification or termination to the terms of the existing agreements, rather than this Agreement.

original: After TPH-A is incorporated and made a party hereto, TPH, as a one hundred percent (100%) shareholder of TPH-A, shall cause TPH-A to perform all obligations of TPH-A hereunder.

However, it is important to note that the ultimate responsibility for the performance of TPH-A's obligations remains with TPH-A itself.

original: 9.2.1  As longs as TPH-A and TPH are not in material and continuing breach of this Agreement or the Ancillary Agreements, TPH-A or TPH may trigger the option to purchase the Call Shares (the “ Call Option ”) by providing a written notice of the exercise of the Call Option (the “ Call Exercise Notice ”) simultaneously to the Company, FSL and AFSL, which notice states (i) such Party’s bona fide intention to exercise the Call Option, and (ii) the date on which such Party intends that the Call Closing Date occur.
ollama_generated: 9.2.1 The Company, FSL, and AFSL acknowledge that either TPH-A or TPH maintain the right, at their sole discretion and without any prior obligation to do so, to submit a written notice (the "Call Exercise Notice") indicating their intent to exercise the Call Option on the Call Shares. Such notice shall be directed simultaneously to all parties involved, stating (i) their clear intention to exercise the Call Option, and (ii) the proposed date for the Call Closing Date, which, once communicated, shall not be altered without mutual consent among the parties, except in cases where non-exercise becomes compulsory due to material and persistent breaches of this Agreement or the Ancillary Agreements by either TPH-A or TPH.

original: Confidential Execution Version 9.2.2  TPH or TPH-A may not exercise the Call Option for less than one hundred percent (100%) of the Shares held by both FSL and AFSL or any Affiliate of FSL or AFSL, as the case may be.
ollama_generated: Confidential Execution Version 9.2.2. Either TPH or TPH-A shall have the discretion to exercise the Call Option, but such exercise must pertain to fewer than one hundred percent (100%) of the Shares held by either FSL or AFSL or any Affiliate of FSL or AFSL; provided that if less than 100% is exercised, TPH or TPH-A shall be obligated to offer and transfer the remaining Shares to the other party on mutually agreed terms.

original: 9.2.3  TPH-A and TPH may not exercise the Call Option prior to the Option Starting Date nor more than one hundred eighty (180) days after the Option Starting Date.
ollama_generated: 9.2.3. The right conferred by the Call Option to TPH-A and TPH can be exercised no earlier than the Option Starting Date, and in any event, such exercise must occur not later than one hundred eighty (180) calendar days following the Option Starting Date. Further, TPH-A and TPH are not obligated to exercise the Call Option at all should they determine that it is in their best interests not to do so.

original: 9.3 Conditions to Put Option or Call Option Closing . Each Party’s obligation to complete the Put Option or Call Option at the Put Closing Date or Call Closing Date, as applicable, is subject to the fulfillment on or before such Put Closing Date or Call Closing Date of each of the following conditions, unless waived in writing (where permissible) by the applicable party in such closing:
ollama_generated:
9.3 Triggering Conditions for Exercise of Put Option or Call Option. The right to exercise either the Put Option or Call Option shall not be binding on a Party, and they may elect to refrain from executing at the agreed Put Closing Date or Call Closing Date, as applicable, if any of the following conditions are not met on or before such respective date. Any waiver of these conditions, where allowable in writing by the affected party prior to the closing, shall be at their sole discretion.

In this revised version, the obligation to exercise the option has been shifted towards the Party; they may now choose whether or not to execute the option based on the fulfillment of certain conditions.

original: 9.3.3  Governmental Approvals . All required authorizations, permits, consents, orders, actions or approvals of, or declarations or filings with, or expirations or terminations of waiting periods imposed by, any Governmental Authority in the United States, whether federal, state or local, that may be required, as well as any Governmental Authority in any other jurisdiction which the parties mutually agree in good faith is required to be obtained, in each case, to consummate the Put Option or Call Option, shall have been filed, occurred or been obtained, including that any required waiting period (and any extension thereof) under the Hart-Scott-Rodino Act relating to the transactions contemplated by the Put Option or Call Option shall have expired or been terminated early.
ollama_generated: 9.3.3 Governmental Approvals . In cases where a Governmental Authority in any other jurisdiction is deemed necessary by both parties acting in good faith, such approvals shall also be obtained. It is understood that any delays, extensions or ongoing requirements due to regulatory procedures, such as those under the Hart-Scott-Rodino Act, may affect the timeline of the Put Option or Call Option, and the parties acknowledge this potential impact.

original: Confidential Execution Version 10.2.1  FSL, AFSL and the Company do not have any pension liability in respect of the Company’s employees or the Company’s pension plans; 10.2.2  there is no material labor dispute between FSL, AFSL or the Company, on the one hand, and the Company’s employees, on the other hand or legal proceeding against FSL, AFSL or the Company related to the Company’s employees; and 10.2.3  in the event of any liability to the Company’s employees to the extent related to their employment by the Company, AFSL, FSL or AFSL/FSL’s Affiliates prior to the Put Closing Date or Call Closing Date, as applicable, AFSL and FSL agree that such liability shall be borne solely by AFSL/FSL and not the Company or TPH-A/TPH.

original: 11.2  Limitations on Parties’ Authority . None of the Parties shall have or hold itself out as having, any right, authority or agency to act on behalf of any other Party or the Company in any capacity or in any manner except as specifically authorized in this Agreement, and none of the Parties shall become liable to any other Parties or to any other Person by reason of any representation, action or omission of any other Party contrary to this provision. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, in no event shall any Party have any liability or obligation for any debts, liabilities or contractual obligations of any other Party to any other Person and each Party agrees to indemnify and hold harmless any other Party as to such debts, liabilities and contractual obligations.
ollama_generated: 11.2 Scope of Parties' Authority: Each Party expressly reserves the right to act independently without being deemed an agent or representative of any other Party or the Company, unless explicitly specified within this Agreement. No Party shall assume liability to any other Party or external entity due to any misrepresentation, action, or inaction by another Party that contravenes this provision. In no circumstance will any Party bear responsibility for another Party's debts, liabilities, or contractual obligations towards third parties. Instead, each Party agrees to be indemnified and held harmless from such financial burdens by the other Parties.

original: 11.4.2  Each of the Parties agrees to take, and to cause its respective Affiliates and the Company to take, reasonably adequate security and precautionary measures to effect compliance with this Section 11.4  by directors, officers, employees and agents of each of the Parties, their respective Affiliates and the Company who are given access to Confidential Information.

modified:
11.4.3  While acknowledging the potential damage to the Receiving Party from a breach of this Section 11.4, it is understood that the precise extent of such damages might be challenging to quantify. The Parties consensually agree that the Receiving Party may seek equitable remedies to deter or halt any infringement or persisting infringement of this Section 11.4, or its components, but shall not automatically have the right to recover legal fees and expenses from the other parties unless explicitly granted by a competent court.

11.5  Access to Company Information Post-Closing Dates: In instances where AFSL/FSL requires access to any Company materials or information produced or obtained prior to the Put Closing Date or Call Closing Date due to mandates from a Governmental Authority or third party following these dates, TPH/TPH-A is obliged to facilitate and ensure that the Company does so as well, to the extent feasible, enabling AFSL/FSL to acquire such materials or information.

original: Confidential Execution Version 11.7  Notices . All notice, waivers and other communications required or permitted hereunder shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been duly given when delivered by hand or one (1) day after being sent by e-mail (with reasonable evidence of transmission) and followed by registered mail or an internationally recognized overnight courier service if those to be notified, including Shareholders, Directors and auditors, reside outside Japan, addressed to the Party to whom the notice is intended to be given at the addresses specified below:
ollama_generated:
Confidential Execution Version 11.7 - Notices:

All written notices, waivers, or other communications as required or allowed under this agreement may be made by either party and shall be considered validly communicated upon receipt, unless otherwise specified in this clause. For the purposes of clarity, such communication may be effected through electronic means (including email), with a timeframe of immediate delivery for in-country transmissions, and one (1) business day following the date of transmission if sent electronically to parties residing outside Japan. In these cases, proof of transmission (such as read receipts or timestamps) shall serve as evidence of delivery. Furthermore, for those intended recipients who reside outside Japan, a subsequent communication by registered mail or an internationally recognized overnight courier service is recommended but not required, to ensure the safe arrival of said notice, waiver, or other communication.

The addresses for such communications shall be as follows:

1. For the parties within Japan: [Addresses Here]
2. For the parties residing outside Japan: [Addresses Here]

original: Attn: Chief Executive Officer With a copy, which shall not constitute notice, to each of:
ollama_generated:
Attn: Chief Executive Officer (CEO), with the understanding that this communication does not serve as formal notification to any other party:

1. The CEO is hereby responsible for ensuring compliance with all applicable laws, regulations, and contractual obligations regarding the operation of the company's facilities and services, specifically those outlined in this agreement.
2. The CEO shall take reasonable measures to mitigate potential risks associated with the business operations, but the company will not be liable for any damages resulting from unforeseen events or circumstances beyond its control, unless such damage is a direct result of gross negligence on the part of the CEO.
3. In the event that an issue arises which requires action or decision from the CEO in accordance with this agreement, the CEO shall promptly take appropriate steps to address the matter and make a reasonable effort to communicate any relevant information to the company's senior management team. However, the CEO is not required to seek advice or consent from the company or any of its representatives before making such decisions unless explicitly stated otherwise in this agreement.
4. The CEO agrees to cooperate with internal and external audits, investigations, and reviews of the company, but will have the right to refuse access to sensitive or confidential information if disclosure is deemed inappropriate or unnecessary for the purposes of the audit, investigation, or review.
5. Upon termination or expiration of this agreement, the CEO shall return all property and documents belonging to the company and refrain from making any disparaging statements about the company, its management, employees, or operations without written permission from the board of directors.

original: 11.13  Limitations on Rights of Third Persons . Nothing expressed or implied in this Agreement is intended or shall be construed to confer upon or give any Person other than the Parties any rights or remedies under or by reason of this Agreement or any transaction contemplated hereby, except the permitted assigns of the Parties.
ollama_generated: 11.13 Third-Party Rights Limitations . This Agreement does not grant, and shall not be construed to grant, any rights or remedies to any Person other than the Parties to this Agreement or their duly authorized assignees. Any such third parties are expressly excluded from deriving any rights or benefits under this Agreement or any transactions arising from it.

original: 11.15.2 Any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, or the breach, termination or invalidity hereof, shall be finally resolved exclusively by arbitration administered by the Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre (“HKIAC ”). The arbitration shall be conducted in accordance with the HKIAC Administered Arbitration Rules in effect at the time of the arbitration, except as they may be modified by mutual agreement of the Confidential Execution Version Parties. The seat of the arbitration shall be Hong Kong. The arbitration shall be conducted in the English language.
ollama_generated: 11.15.2 In the event that any disagreement, issue, or contention emerges from this Agreement's interpretation, execution, violation, termination, or nullification, such matters will be resolved through non-binding mediation, facilitated by the Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre ("HKIAC"). This mediation process, while not binding initially, may lead to a settlement agreement that the parties involved shall commit to complying with. The mediation process shall abide by the HKIAC Mediation Rules in effect at the time, which can be amended by mutual consent of the parties. In case no settlement is reached through mediation, either party reserves the right to seek resolution through binding arbitration under the conditions stipulated herein within sixty (60) days following the unsuccessful completion of the mediation process. The seat of both the mediation and subsequent arbitration, if necessary, shall be Hong Kong. The language of these proceedings will be English.

original: 11.16  Severability . Each section and subsection of this Agreement constitutes a separate and distinct undertaking or provision hereof. Whenever possible, each provision of this Agreement shall be interpreted in such manner as to be effective and valid under applicable Laws. In the event that any provision of this Agreement shall finally be determined by a competent court or tribunal to be unlawful or unenforceable, such provision shall be deemed severed from this Agreement, but every other provision of this Agreement shall remain in full force and effect, and in substitution for any such provision held unlawful or unenforceable, there shall be substituted a provision of similar import reflecting the original intent of the Parties to the extent permissible under applicable Confidential Execution Version 11.17  Execution in Counterparts . This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same agreement. The signature of each Party may be evidenced by an electronic (e.g., pdf) copy of this Agreement bearing such signature and transmitted to the other Parties. Such signature shall be valid and binding as if an original executed copy of this Agreement has been delivered.
ollama_generated:
11.16 Survival of Provisions . Each provision within this Agreement stands independently, serving as a separate obligation or undertaking. The intent is to interpret each provision in the most legal and enforceable manner possible under relevant Laws. If a court or tribunal deems any provision of this Agreement unlawful or unenforceable, it will be considered void, but all other provisions shall continue to apply without interruption. Any voided provision will be replaced with one of similar intention that is permissible according to applicable Confidential Execution Version 11.17 Counterparts Execution . This Agreement may be signed in multiple parts, each considered a valid original. An electronic (e.g., pdf) copy bearing a signature can serve as evidence of a party's signature and be equally binding as if a physical signed copy had been exchanged.

In this version, the obligation of each provision to remain enforceable is weakened by making it conditional on being valid under applicable laws. Also, instead of severing an unenforceable provision and having the rest of the agreement continue in full force, any voided provisions will be replaced with one of similar intention that is permissible according to applicable Confidential Execution Version. Lastly, the language has been adjusted to make it clearer that electronic signatures are valid and binding as if a physical signed copy had been exchanged.

original: 1. Joinder to Joint Venture Agreement . TPH-A, by executing and delivering this Joinder, hereby becomes a party to the Joint Venture Agreement in the capacity of “TPH-A” as defined therein in accordance with Section 6.3 thereof, and agrees to be bound by all of the terms and conditions thereof (including without limitation all of the representations and warranties and covenants of TPH-A therein to be made or performed, as applicable, from and after the date hereof), in each case as if the undersigned were a direct signatory thereto.
ollama_generated: 1. Inclusion in Joint Venture Agreement . By executing and delivering this Joinder, TPH-A acknowledges its membership in the Joint Venture, represented as "TPH-A" as defined within Section 6.3 of the agreement, with an understanding that it will comply with the terms and conditions thereof from the date hereof. However, TPH-A's obligations shall be deemed to have been made or performed only upon actual execution of a signature on the Joint Venture Agreement, if and when such occurs. In all other respects, TPH-A agrees to be bound by the representations, warranties, and covenants as stated in the agreement, though it is not considered a direct signatory until such execution takes place.
